request.description:
> Beta warning: This API is still in beta. This means that it may still undergo incompatible changes. 
  

Create a new Limit Order which will be repriced by 1 tick to the best bid or best ask (or by the "postOnlyRepriceTicks" value) if the specified price were to match. This ensures Limit Post Only Reprice orders are always placed, and execute as maker trades.

The JSON body used to create a limit order looks like this:

``` json
{
    "side": "BUY",
    "quantity": "0.0001",
    "price": "656596",
    "pair": "BTCUSDT",
    "postOnlyReprice": true,
    "postOnlyRepriceTicks": "1",
    "customerOrderId": "Reprice1",
    "timeInForce": "GTC"
}

 ```

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| side (required) | `BUY` or `SELL` (must be uppercase) |
| quantity (required) | Base amount (the amount submitted will be truncated to `baseDecimalPlaces` of the currency pair) |
| price (required) | Price per coin in quote currency |
| pair (required) | Must be a supported currency pair e.g., `SOLUSDC`, `BTCUSDT`, `ETHUSDT`, `AVAXUSDT`. |
| postOnlyReprice (required) | `true` or `false`. Must be `true` for order repricing. |
| postOnlyRepriceTicks (optional) | Numeric value (Default: `1`, Max: `50`). Number of ticks away from the other side of the book if the order were to match. |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Alphanumeric value. See below for explanation. |
| timeInForce (optional) | Can be `GTC`, `FOK`, or `IOC` (must be uppercase). Default value is `GTC`. See below for explanation. |

---

**Notes**

- **`postOnlyReprice`**:  
    Must be `true` for the order to reprice if the order matches as it's placed.

- **`postOnlyRepriceTicks`**:  
    The number of ticks away from the other side of the book if the order were to match. Default value is `1`, Max is `50`.

- **`customerOrderId`**:  
    An optional field which can be specified by clients to track this order using their own internal order management systems. It supports alphanumeric characters and dashes ("-"), with a 50-character limit. Special characters are not allowed. The `customerOrderId` must be **unique across all open orders** for a given account. Reusing an `id` from an active order will prevent the new order from being placed (use the order status API to check an orderâ€™s status).

- **`postOnly`**:  
    Setting `postOnly=true` will place a Maker order and cause it to fail if it is matched immediately.

- **`timeInForce`**:  
    Specifies the duration that an order will remain active. Post only reprice orders have to use `GTC`.

- **Order Retrieval**:  
    When you retrieve open orders or order history, the `customerOrderId` (if specified during creation) and VALR's `orderId` will both be returned.

- **Order Cancellation**:  
    You can cancel an order by specifying either `orderId` or `customerOrderId`, but **not both**.


**PLEASE NOTE**: When you receive a response with an id,  
it does not always mean that the order has been placed.  
When the response is `202 Accepted`, you can use the  
Order Status REST API or use WebSocket API to receive the status  
of this order. The reasons why an order could fail are as follows:

- Insufficient balance in your account.
    
- If you're using a non-unique `customerOrderId`.
    
- Self trading: If your order matches against your own order (on the other side).
    
- Insufficient liquidity: If you're placing an order and there isn't liquidity to fulfil the order.

request.description:
Get historical orders placed by you.

## Filtering by `startTime` or `endTime`or `statuses`

The `startTime` or `endTime` parameters may be used to filter the returned items by the `orderUpdatedAt` date. The parameters will be interpreted as being in the UTC time zone and must be supplied in the ISO 8601 format (`2023-10-29T22:00:00.000Z`). These two parameters may be used together or separately. When `startTime` is used, orders that have occurred since `startTime` are returned. When `endTime` is used, orders that have occurred up to and including `endTime` are returned.

In addition `startTime` and `endTime` can be used in conjunction with `skip` and `limit`. When specified together you will be able to paginate the result within the time range specified.

Example:

- `startTime` specified as `2023-09-01T00:00:00.000Z`
    
- `endTime` specified as `2023-10-01T00:00:00.000Z`
    
- `skip` specified as 0 and `limit` 100
    

This will example will return the most recent 100 orders between the `startTime` and `endTime`

The `statuses` parameter may be used to filter the returned items by a comma-separated list of statuses from the following list of supported order statuses:

- PLACED
    
- FAILED
    
- CANCELLED
    
- FILLED
    
- PARTIALLY_FILLED
    
- ACTIVE
    
- EXPIRED
    
- PARTIALLY_FILLED_DUE_TO_SLIPPAGE
    
- ORDER_MODIFIED
    

## Filtering byÂ `currencyPair`

TheÂ `currencyPair`Â parameter may be used to filter the returned items by the currency pair symbol (Example:Â `BTCUSDC`,Â `SOLUSDC`Â etc.).

## Additional filtersÂ `showZeroVolumeCancels & excludeFailures`

The `showZeroVolumeCancels` parameter can be used to toogle cancelled orders that did not match. The default value is `false`.

Setting the `excludeFailures` parameter to `true` will filter failed orders from the returned items. The default value is `false`.

request.description:
Modify `Open` and `Partially Filled` Limit Orders

**Note:** This API is still in Beta phase but stable. We would love to improve the user experience with your feedback. We urge you to share any suggestions by logging a quick Feature Request on our [Support Portal](https://support.valr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360000447220)

The following values of an open or partially filled limit order can be modified.

- Price
    
- Total Quantity
    
- Remaining Quantity
    

- Either newRemainingQuantity or newTotalQuantity can be specified in the same request, but not both
    
- Reducing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will maintain the modified orderâ€™s position in the order queue.
    
- Increasing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
    
- Modifying the price up or down will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
    

Modified orders retain their original orderId and the audit trail can be viewed in the Detailed Order History API Call

When the response is `202 - Accepted`, this means that the `Modify Order` request has been submitted. However, this does not always mean that the order has been modified as requested.

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| orderId (required) | Placed order Id provided by VALR |
| pair (required) | Currency pair for the `orderId`. |
| modifyMatchStrategy (required) | `RETAIN_ORIGINAL` which keeps the original order or `CANCEL_ORIGINAL` to cancel the original order or `REPRICE` which if it wouldâ€™ve resulted in a match, instead adjusts the order price to 1 tick below best ask (buy order) or 1 tick above best bid (sell order) |
| newRemainingQuantity (optional) | New base quantity to be executed, irrespective of any existing quantity on the order book at the time of processing the request |
| newTotalQuantity (optional) | New total base quantity for the order. If newTotalQuantity is less than the filled quantity, the order is canceled. Otherwise, newTotalQuantity minus filled quantity |
| newPrice (optional) | Requested new price in base currency |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Placed order ID provided by customer. Alphanumeric with no special chars, limit of 50 characters. |

- `customerOrderId` has to be unique across all open orders for a given account. If you do reuse an `id` value that is currently an active open order, your order will not be placed (you can check the status of an order using the order status API call).
    
- When you retrieve `All Open Orders` or `Order History` the `customerOrderId` field will also be returned along with the VALR's `orderId` for the orders in which this field was specified in the request.
    

The reasons why a Modify Order request could fail are as follows:

- Insufficient balance in your account.
    
- If you're using a non-unique `customerOrderId`.
    
- Self trading: If your order matches against your own order (on the other side).
    
- Insufficient liquidity: If you're placing an order and there isn't enough liquidity on the order book to fulfil the order.
    
- Minimum order size is not met. In this case, the response will be `accepted:false`, with the failure reason.
    
- When there is nothing to modify, i.e. you request the same values as specified in the original order.

request.description:
Modify `Open` and `Partially Filled` Limit Orders

**Note:** This API is still in Beta phase but stable. We would love to improve the user experience with your feedback. We urge you to share any suggestions by logging a quick Feature Request on our [Support Portal](https://support.valr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360000447220)

The following values of an open or partially filled limit order can be modified.

- Price
- Total Quantity
- Remaining Quantity
- Either newRemainingQuantity or newTotalQuantity can be specified in the same request, but not both
- Reducing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will maintain the modified orderâ€™s position in the order queue.
- Increasing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
- Modifying the price up or down will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
    

Modified orders retain their original orderId and the audit trail can be viewed in the Detailed Order History API Call

When the response is `201 - CREATED`, this means that the `Modify Order` request has been submitted and processed successfully.

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| orderId (required) | Placed order Id provided by VALR |
| pair (required) | Currency pair for the `orderId`. |
| modifyMatchStrategy (required) | `RETAIN_ORIGINAL` which keeps the original order or `CANCEL_ORIGINAL` to cancel the original order |
| newRemainingQuantity (optional) | New base quantity to be executed, irrespective of any existing quantity on the order book at the time of processing the request |
| newTotalQuantity (optional) | New total base quantity for the order. If newTotalQuantity is less than the filled quantity, the order is canceled. Otherwise, newTotalQuantity minus filled quantity |
| newPrice (optional) | Requested new price in base currency |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Placed order ID provided by customer. Alphanumeric with no special chars, limit of 50 characters. |

- `customerOrderId` has to be unique across all open orders for a given account. If you do reuse an `id` value that is currently an active open order, your order will not be placed (you can check the status of an order using the order status API call).
- When you retrieve `All Open Orders` or `Order History` the `customerOrderId` field will also be returned along with the VALR's `orderId` for the orders in which this field was specified in the request.
    

The reasons why a Modify Order request could fail are as follows:

- Insufficient balance in your account.
- If you're using a non-unique `customerOrderId`.
- Self trading: If your order matches against your own order (on the other side).
- Insufficient liquidity: If you're placing an order and there isn't enough liquidity on the order book to fulfil the order.
- Minimum order size is not met. In this case, the response will be `accepted:false`, with the failure reason.
- When there is nothing to modify, i.e. you request the same values as specified in the original order.
    

**PLEASE NOTE**:

- When you receive a `201 Created` response with an id, it means that the order has been successfully modified. You can use the Order Status REST API or use WebSocket API to receive the status of this order.
- When an order fails during the order modifificaton process you can expect to receive a `modifyOrderId`, `orderId`, `code` and `message` in the response body. See example below.
    

``` json
{
    "modifyOrderId": "d1e05e7e-7cd3-11ee-8c68-417193a135ba",
    "orderId": "d1d1130d-6c26-49a4-8637-3a6ba2463ae5",
    "code": -21303,
    "message": "Modify order would not have modified anything and was cancelled"
}

 ```

request.description:
Modify conditional orders.

The following values of a conditional order can be modified.

- Price
- Quantity
- Take Profit Trigger Price
- Take Profit Order Price
- Stop Loss Trigger Price
- Stop Loss Order Price    

Adding a missing Stop Loss (SL) or Take Profit (TP) trigger turns the conditional order into a one-cancel-other (OCO) conditional order. If the trigger already exists, the price will be modified.

Modified conditional orders retain their original orderId and the audit trail can be viewed in the Detailed Order History API Call



| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| orderId (optional) | Placed order Id provided by VALR. Required if `customerOrderId` isn't used. |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Alphanumeric value. Required if `orderId` isn't used. See below for explanation. |
| pair (required) | Currency pair for the `orderId`. |
| newQuantity (optional) | The value in base amount (the amount submitted will be truncated to baseDecimalPlaces of the currency pair) |
| newTakeProfitTriggerPrice (optional) | If Take Profit, the mark price or last traded price to trigger the conditional order. |
| newTakeProfitOrderPrice (optional) | If Take Profit, the price at which the conditional order will be placed. |
| newStopLossTriggerPrice (optional) | If Stop Loss, the mark price or last traded price to trigger the conditional order. |
| newStopLossOrderPrice (optional) | If Stop Loss,The price at which the conditional order will be placed. |


**Notes**

- **`customerOrderId`**:  
    Optional field for tracking orders using your internal system. It supports alphanumeric characters and dashes ("-"), with a 50-character limit. Special characters are not allowed.

The reasons why a Modify Order request could fail are as follows:

- Minimum order size is not met. In this case, the response will be `accepted:false`, with the failure reason.
- When there is nothing to modify, i.e. you request the same values as specified in the original order.

request.description:
Modify a batch of open and partially filled Limit Orders in a single request.

**Note:** This API is still in Beta phase but stable. We would love to improve the user experience with your feedback. We urge you to share any suggestions by logging a quick Feature Request on our [Support Portal](https://support.valr.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360000447220)

The following values of an open or partially filled limit order can be modified.

- Price
- Total Quantity
- Remaining Quantity
    

- Either newRemainingQuantity or newTotalQuantity can be specified in the same request, but not both
- Reducing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will maintain the modified orderâ€™s position in the order queue.
- Increasing the Total quantity or Remaining quantity will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
- Modifying the price up or down will move the modified order to the back of the order queue.
    

Modified orders retain their original orderId and the audit trail can be viewed in the Detailed Order History API Call

When the response is `202 - Accepted`, this means that the `Modify Order` request has been submitted. However, this does not always mean that the order has been modified as requested.

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| type (required) | MODIFY_ORDER |
| orderId (required) | Placed order Id provided by VALR |
| pair (required) | Currency pair for the `orderId`. |
| modifyMatchStrategy (required) | `RETAIN_ORIGINAL` which keeps the original order or `CANCEL_ORIGINAL` to cancel the original order |
| newRemainingQuantity (optional) | Requested new base quantity to be executed |
| newTotalQuantity (optional) | Requested new total quantity to be executed |
| newPrice (optional) | Requested new price in base currency |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Placed order ID provided by customer. Alphanumeric with no special chars, limit of 50 characters. |

- `customerOrderId` has to be unique across all open orders for a given account. If you do reuse an `id` value that is currently an active open order, your order will not be placed (you can check the status of an order using the order status API call).
- When you retrieve `All Open Orders` or `Order History` the `customerOrderId` field will also be returned along with the VALR's `orderId` for the orders in which this field was specified in the request.
    

The reasons why a Modify Order request could fail are as follows:

- Insufficient balance in your account.
- If you're using a non-unique `customerOrderId`.
- Self trading: If your order matches against your own order (on the other side).
- Insufficient liquidity: If you're placing an order and there isn't enough liquidity on the order book to fulfil the order.
- Minimum order size is not met. In this case, the response will be `accepted:false`, with the failure reason.
- When there is nothing to modify, i.e. you request the same values as specified in the original order.

request.description:
Cancel an open order.

A `200 OK` response means the request to cancel the order was accepted. You can either use the Order Status REST API or use the WebSocket API to receive status updates about this request.

The `DELETE` request requires a JSON request body in the following format:

``` json
{
  "orderId": "UUID",
  "pair": "BTCUSDT"
}

 ```

Alternatively, the body can be of the following format if you specified a `customerOrderId` when creating your order:

``` json
{
  "customerOrderId": "^[0-9a-zA-Z-]{0,50}$",
  "pair": "BTCUSDT"
}

 ```

NOTE: When you receive this response, it does not always mean that the order has been canceled.  
When the response is `200 OK`, you can either use the Order Status REST API or use the WebSocket API to receive status updates about this order.

item.description:
Make use of our Exchange Buy/Sell APIs to place your orders on the Exchange programmatically.

These APIs are protected and will require authentication. See the section on `Authentication` above to learn how to authenticate your API calls.

# V2 API Motivation
When our V1 API returns a `202 Accepted` it does not guarantee that the order was placed. However, the V2 API will return `201 Created` whenever the order was successfully placed/modified on the order book and`200 Ok` when successfully cancelled. Otherwise a `400` is returned with the reason. This allows a synchronous programming model where the response either indicates a successful placement, or a failure.

# List of possible Order Statuses
| Enum                                 | Description                             |
|--------------------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| PLACED                               | Placed                                   |
| FAILED                               | Failed                                   |
| CANCELLED                            | Cancelled                                |
| FILLED                               | Filled                                   |
| PARTIALLY_FILLED                     | Partially Filled                         |
| EXPIRED                              | Expired                                  |
| PARTIALLY_FILLED_DUE_TO_SLIPPAGE     | Partially Filled Due To Slippage         |
| ORDER_MODIFIED                       | Order Modified                           |
| REPRICED_DUE_TO_SLIPPAGE             | Repriced Due To Slippage                 |

header.description: Your API Key
Request Signature generated for this request. See section about **Authentication** above to learn how to generate this request signature.

The same timestamp used to generate the request signature (in Unix epoch time format, in milliseconds). 

Example: If the current date and time is `December 28, 2019 00:00:00 UTC`. then the Unix epoch time would be `1577491200000`. Note that this timestamp is in milliseconds.

request.description:
Generate a new brokerage instruction quote.

This quote is not guaranteed but serves as an indicator of how the brokerage instruction will execute.

Example request body:

``` json
{
    "payAmount": "100", 
    "payCurrency": "ZAR",
    "receiveCurrency": "AGRI",
    "feeRate": "0.01",
    "feeCurrency": "AGRI",
    "feeAccountId": 1315586846625202176,
    "customerOrderId": "brokerage-order-01"
}

 ```

| Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| payAmount (required) | The total amount to be traded. The trade and brokerage fees should be included in this amount. |
| payCurrency (required) | The currency for the amount specified in `payAmount` |
| receiveCurrency (required) | The currency that will be received after the simple order / swap completes. |
| feeRate (required) | The brokerage fee levied. `0.000` to `0.999` allowed |
| feeCurrency (required) | The currency in which the brokerage fee is to be collected. This should match either `payCurrency` or `receiveCurrency`. |
| feeAccountId (optional) | The account id of the account to which the brokerage fee will be transfered. This can be set to `0` to receive the fee in the main account. If not included, `0` is used as the default. |
| customerOrderId (optional) | Custom order id. |

**Notes**

- The account on which the trade is performed can be specified using the http header. Please see our Subaccounts section for more information. Not including the header will result in the order being placed against your main account.
    
- `feeAccountId`:  
    This account cannot be the same as the account in which the simple order / simple swap is placed.
    
- `customerOrderId`:  
    Optional field for tracking orders using your internal system. It supports alphanumeric characters with a 50-character limit. Special characters are not allowed.
    
- `feeCurrency`:  
    If the `feeCurrency` matches the `payCurrency` then the brokerage fee will be calculated from the `payAmount` prior the simple order being placed. If the `feeCurrency` matches the `receiveCurrency` then the brokerage fee will be calculated after the simple order / swap has completed and will be a percentage of the received amount.
    
- `feeRate`:  
    Fees are specified as a fraction. ie: a 10% brokerage fee can be specified as `0.1`
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "requestPayAmount": "100",
    "actualPayAmount": "100",
    "payCurrency": "ZAR",
    "receiveCurrency": "AGRI",
    "receiveAmount": "75",
    "averagePrice": "1.3",
    "leg1CurrencyPair": "USDTZAR",
    "leg2CurrencyPair": "AGRIUSDT",
    "averagePriceInPayCurrency": "1.3",
    "averagePriceInReceiveCurrency": "0.786",
    "feeRate": "0.01",
    "feeAmount": "0.75",
    "feeCurrency": "AGRI",
    "feeAccountId": 1315586846625202176,
    "customerOrderId": "brokerage-order-01"
    "leg1TradeFeeAmount": "0.031413",
    "leg1TradeFeeCurrency": "USDT",
    "leg2TradeFeeAmount": "0.456",
    "leg2TradeFeeCurrency": "AGRI"
}

 ```

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| requestPayAmount | The total value of the brokerage instruction as specified in request's `payAmount` |
| actualPayAmount | The expected amount the simple order or swap was placed for |
| payCurrency | The currency for the amount specified in payAmount |
| receiveCurrency | The currency that will be received after the simple order / swap completes |
| receiveAmount | The expected amount received in `receiveCurrency` after the simple order / swap completes |
| averagePrice | The expected average price for the simple order / swap. The average price is exclusive of the VALR fees for the simple order / simple swap. |
| leg1CurrencyPair | The currency pair used for the simple order or the first of two trades in the simple swap |
| leg2CurrencyPair | The second currency pair used for the second of two trades in the simple swap order. This field will not be included in the result if a simple order is used. |
| averagePriceInPayCurrency | The expected average price for the simple order / swap expressed in the currency defined in `payCurrency`. The average price is exclusive of the VALR fees for the simple order / simple swap. |
| averagePriceInReceiveCurrency | The expected average price for the simple order / swap expressed in the currency defined in `receiveCurrency`. The average price is exclusive of the VALR fees for the simple order / simple swap. |
| customerOrderId | The custom order id specified in the request |
| leg1TradeFeeAmount | The trade fees levied by VALR for the simple order or the first of two trades in a simple swap order |
| leg1TradeFeeCurrency | The currency in which `leg1TradeFeeAmount` will be levied |
| leg2TradeFeeAmount | The trade fees levied by VALR for the second of two trades in a simple swap order. This field will not be included in the result if a simple order is used. |
| leg2TradeFeeCurrency | The currency in which `leg2TradeFeeAmount` will be levied. This field will not be included in the result if a simple order is used. |

request.description:
Get brokerage instruction history.

To retrieve all instructions across all subaccounts, make this request for your main account and specify `includeSubAccounts=true` as a query parameter.

To retrieve all instructions for a particular subaccount, make this request using the `X-VALR-SUB-ACCOUNT-ID` header. Please see the `Account / Subaccounts` section for more information.

| Query Parameter | Description |
| --- | --- |
| includeSubAccounts (optional) | `TRUE` or `FALSE` If true, brokerage instruction history will be returned for the main account and all the subaccounts. Default: `FALSE` |

Example Response:

``` json
[
    {
        "identifier": "48657a89-5ff6-483c-a8d4-e8a1d0648fb4",
        "orderId": "de689cf3-f667-4104-905b-2fdb439618bc",
        "transferId": "377573",
        "accountId": 0,
        "feeAccountId": 1311349150067826688,
        "requestedPayAmount": "100",
        "actualPayAmount": "99.99857355",
        "payCurrency": "ZAR",
        "receiveCurrency": "AGRI",
        "receiveAmount": "75.544",
        "feeRate": "0.01",
        "feeCurrency": "AGRI",
        "feeAmount": "0.75544",

        "createdAt": 1739378546678,

        "leg1TradeFeeCurrency": "USDT",
        "leg2TradeFeeAmount": "0.456",
        "leg2TradeFeeCurrency": "AGRI"
    }
]
 ```

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| identifier | Unique identifier for the brokerage instruction |
| orderId | Order id for the simple swap or the simple order that is placed as part of the brokerage instruction |
| transferId | The id of the internal transfer that was used to sweep the brokerage fee into the `feeAccount` |
| accountId | Account on which the simple order / simple swap took place. `0` indicates the main account was used. |
| feeAccountId | The account to which the brokerage fee was transfered |
| requestedPayAmount | The total value of the brokerage instruction as specified in request's `payAmount` |
| actualPayAmount | The total amount the simple order or swap was placed for |
| payCurrency | The currency for the amount specified in `payAmount` |
| receiveCurrency | The currency received after the simple order / swap completed |
| receiveAmount | The amount received in `receiveCurrency` after the simple order / swap completed |
| feeRate | The rate of the brokerage fee levied |
| feeCurrency | The currency in which the brokerage fee was collected. This will match either payCurrency or receiveCurrency. |
| feeAmount | The total amount of the brokerage fee collected. Expressed in the currency defined in `feeCurrency` |
| customerOrderId | The custom order id specified in the request |
| leg1TradeFeeAmount | The trade fees levied by VALR for the simple order or the first of two trades in a simple swap order. |
| leg1TradeFeeCurrency | The currency in which `leg1TradeFeeAmount` was levied |
| leg2TradeFeeAmount | The trade fees levied by VALR for the second of two trades in a simple swap order. This field will not be included in the result if a simple order is used. |
| leg2TradeFeeCurrency | The currency in which `leg2TradeFeeAmount` was levied. This field will not be included in the result if a simple order is used. |

The same timestamp used to generate the request signature (in Unix epoch time format, in milliseconds). 

Example: If the current date and time is `December 28, 2019 00:00:00 UTC`. then the Unix epoch time would be `1577491200000`. Note that this timestamp is in milliseconds.

variable.description: The unique id of the simple order or simple swap

item.description:
Brokerage instructions define a simple order or simple swap. This instruction includes the brokerage fee rate that will be levied against the order and the account identifier to which the fee is swept.

Brokerage Instructions trigger a 2 part process. The first part places a simple swap or a simple order depending on the pairs available for the trade. Once the trade completes an internal transfer is performed to move the fee from the account where the trade occurred to another account.

This can be a simple order or a simple swap. Please see our fees for clarity on how simple orders and simple swaps are billed.

This API is protected and will require authentication. See the section on `Authentication` to learn how to authenticate your API calls.

#### API Key Requirements

The API key used to get brokerage quotes and place brokerage instructions will require `Trade` and `Internal Transfer` permissions. This is due to the brokerage instructions being a two part process with a simple order / simple swap followed by an internal transfer of the brokerage fee into the fee account.

item.name: WebSocket API
Account
Read
item.description:
## Events (On `Account` WebSocket)

Here is a list of events you can subscribe to on the `Account` WebSocket connection:

| Event | Description |
| --- | --- |
| MARGIN_INFO | Receive periodic notifications of the account's current margin information, currently sent every 5 seconds. (Beta) |

### MARGIN_INFO

In order to subscribe to the **MARGIN_INFO** event, you must send the following message on the `Account` WebSocket connection once it is opened:

``` json
{ 
  "type": "SUBSCRIBE", 
  "subscriptions": [
    { 
      "event":"MARGIN_INFO" 
    }
  ] 
}

 ```

On subscription the latest update is sent immediately.

You can unsubscribe from `MARGIN_INFO`, `BALANCE_UPDATE` and `OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE` events. To unsubscribe, send an `UNSUBSCRIBE` message listing the event types to unsubscribe from.

For example, to unsubscribe from all three supported events, send this message:

``` json
{
  "type": "UNSUBSCRIBE",
  "requests": [
    {
      "event": "MARGIN_INFO"
    },
    {
      "event": "BALANCE_UPDATE"
    },
    {
      "event": "OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

## Message Feeds (On `Account` WebSocket)

As soon as the connection is established, the client is automatically subscribed to all events on the `Account` WebSocket connection. If needed, the client can unsubscribe from any events as described below.

On connection and authentication to the `Account` WebSocket we will now send all account balances, open orders and positions associated with the user account. We will send one **BALANCE_UPDATE** message for each asset held and one **OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE** message containing all open orders by the account, across all order books.
Users can also unsubscribe from these by following the example provided above.

Here is a list of events that occur on the `Account` WebSocket and the corresponding sample message feed:

### NEW_ACCOUNT_HISTORY_RECORD : _New successful transaction_

Sample message feed:

``` json
 {

        },

        "creditCurrency": {
            "symbol": "BTC",
            "decimalPlaces": 8,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "BTC",
            "longName": "Bitcoin",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
            "collateral": true,
            "collateralWeight": "0.975"
        },
        "creditValue": "4.65205751577",
        "feeCurrency": {
            "symbol": "BTC",
            "decimalPlaces": 8,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "BTC",
            "longName": "Bitcoin",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
            "collateral": true,
            "collateralWeight": "0.975"
        },
        "feeValue": "0.00465671423",
        "eventAt": "2022-11-14T20:00:58.263Z",
        "additionalInfo": {
            "costPerCoin": 800000,
            "costPerCoinSymbol": "R",
            "currencyPairSymbol": "BTCZAR",
            "orderId": "3904a62e-756c-4b02-aa15-ec9c3d19bd7d"
        },
        "id": "a3c85807-34ed-4515-84a2-6f9b863947ed"
    }
}
{
    "type": "NEW_ACCOUNT_HISTORY_RECORD",
    "data": {
        "transactionType": {
            "type": "SIMPLE_BUY",
            "description": "Simple Buy"
        },
        "debitCurrency": {
            "symbol": "R",
            "decimalPlaces": 2,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "ZAR",
            "longName": "Rand",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 2,
            "collateral": true,
            "collateralWeight": "1"
        },
        "debitValue": "11.999995",
        "creditCurrency": {
            "symbol": "ETH",
            "decimalPlaces": 18,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "ETH",
            "longName": "Ethereum",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
            "collateral": false,
            "collateralWeight": "0.0"
        },
        "creditValue": "0.003402855725",
        "feeCurrency": {
            "symbol": "ETH",
            "decimalPlaces": 18,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "ETH",
            "longName": "Ethereum",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
            "collateral": false,
            "collateralWeight": "0.0"
        },
        "feeValue": "0.000025714275",
        "eventAt": "2022-11-21T13:09:11.339Z",
        "additionalInfo": {
            "costPerCoin": 3500,
            "costPerCoinSymbol": "R",

 ```

---

### BALANCE_UPDATE : _Balance has been updated_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
    "type": "BALANCE_UPDATE",
    "data": {
        "currency": {
            "symbol": "BTC",
            "decimalPlaces": 8,
            "isActive": true,
            "shortName": "BTC",
            "longName": "Bitcoin",
            "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
            "collateral": true,
            "collateralWeight": "0.95"
        },
        "available": "0.00002887",
        "reserved": "0",
        "total": "0.00002887",
        "updatedAt": "2023-03-12T03:28:36.600Z",
        "lendReserved": "0",
        "borrowCollateralReserved": "0",
        "borrowedAmount": "0",
        "totalInReference": "14.84599332",
        "totalInReferenceWeighted": "14.103693654",
        "referenceCurrency": "ZAR"
    }
}

 ```

---

### NEW_ACCOUNT_TRADE : _New trade executed on your account_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "NEW_ACCOUNT_TRADE",
  "currencyPairSymbol": "BTCUSDT",
  "data": {
    "price": "114,953",
    "quantity": "0.0001",
    "currencyPair": "BTCUSDT",
    "tradedAt": "2025-10-28T07:13:21.635Z",
    "side": "buy",
    "orderId": "019a29aa-0cd9-75d6-813c-994bab34c642",
    "id": "019a29aa-0ce3-75db-bfc2-dd543aa745db",
    "fee": "0.0000001",
    "feeCurrency": "BTC",
    "customerOrderId": "marketWS"
  }
}

 ```

---

### INSTANT_ORDER_COMPLETED: _New Simple Buy/Sell executed_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "INSTANT_ORDER_COMPLETED",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "247dc157-bb5b-49af-b476-2f613b780697",
    "success": true,
    "paidAmount": "10",
    "paidCurrency": "R",
    "receivedAmount": "0.00104473",
    "receivedCurrency": "BTC",
    "feeAmount": "0.00000789",
    "feeCurrency": "BTC",
    "orderExecutedAt": "2019-04-25T20:36:53.445"
  }
}

 ```

---

### OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE : _New order added to open orders_

Sample message feed (all open orders are returned):

``` json
{
  "type": "OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE",
  "data": [
    {
      "orderId": "01972090-c325-7c8d-beed-203ff3630ba6",
      "side": "sell",
      "quantity": "0.0001",
      "price": "2100000",
      "currencyPair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
      "createdAt": "2025-05-30T09:40:47.525Z",
      "originalQuantity": "0.0001",
      "filledPercentage": "0.00",
      "customerOrderId": "MyLimit123",
      "type": "post-only limit",
      "status": "Placed",
      "updatedAt": "2025-05-30T09:40:47.526Z",
      "timeInForce": "GTC",
      "allowMargin": false
    },
    {
      "orderId": "01972090-dcc2-7f16-9343-fa3749aa4f9d",
      "side": "sell",
      "quantity": "0.0001",
      "price": "2200000",
      "currencyPair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
      "createdAt": "2025-05-30T09:40:54.082Z",
      "originalQuantity": "0.0001",
      "filledPercentage": "0.00",
      "type": "post-only limit",
      "status": "Placed",
      "updatedAt": "2025-05-30T09:40:54.084Z",
      "timeInForce": "GTC",
      "allowMargin": false
    }
  ]
}

 ```

---

### OPEN_ORDERS_UPDATE : _Open order modified_

Sample message feed (all open orders are returned) :

``` json
{
  "type": "ORDER_STATUS_UPDATE",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "019a29d0-4362-7dc9-a51d-3533a4bdcf2d",
    "orderStatusType": "Order Modified",
    "currencyPair": "BTCUSDT",
    "originalPrice": "114920",
    "remainingQuantity": "0.0002",
    "originalQuantity": "0.0002",
    "orderSide": "buy",
    "orderType": "post-only limit",
    "failedReason": "",
    "orderUpdatedAt": "2025-10-28T07:56:21.483Z",
    "orderCreatedAt": "2025-10-28T07:55:05.955Z",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS",
    "executedPrice": "0",
    "executedQuantity": "0",
    "executedFee": "0",
    "timeInForce": "GTC"
  }
}

 ```

### OPEN_POSITION_UPDATE : _Open futures position modified_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "OPEN_POSITION_UPDATE",
  "data": {
    "pair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
    "side": "buy",
    "quantity": "0.0003",
    "realisedPnl": "0.08067945",
    "totalSessionEntryQuantity": "0.0003",
    "totalSessionValue": "10.9272",
    "sessionAverageEntryPrice": "36424",
    "averageEntryPrice": "36137",
    "unrealisedPnl": "-0.0567",
    "updatedAt": "2023-11-16T18:57:38.013Z",
    "createdAt": "2023-11-15T11:34:38.186Z",
    "positionId": "08dea401-ba23-ded0-28a9-03d6d59c32a4"
    "leverageTier": 27
  }
}

 ```

---

### REDUCE_POSITION : _Reduced futures position_

On a partial close, you will receive `REDUCE_POSITION` and `OPEN_POSITION_UPDATE` events. On a full close, you will receive `REDUCE_POSITION` and `POSITION_CLOSED` events.

- For `REDUCE_POSITION`, the `quantity` field specifies the amount by which the position was reduced.  
- For `OPEN_POSITION_UPDATE`, the `quantity` field specifies the remaining position amount.

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "REDUCE_POSITION",
  "data": {
    "currencyPair": "USDTZARPERP",
    "orderSide": "buy",
    "quantity": "140.576",
    "averageEntryPrice": "18.0002",
    "closePrice": "18",
    "realisedPnl": "-3.5706498",
    "closeType": "Trade",
    "createdAt": "2025-05-30T11:13:08.898Z",
    "fees": "3.5425346",
    "positionId": "27b1f2f1-a500-8dea-28a9-03190309a944",
    "initialMarginFractionAtClose": "0.1"
  }
}

 ```

---

### POSITION_CLOSED : _Closed futures position_

The `POSITION_CLOSED` event is triggered only when a position is fully closed. If you manually close a position, you will receive both `REDUCE_POSITION` and `POSITION_CLOSED`. If a trade closes an existing position and flips it to the opposite side, you will first receive `REDUCE_POSITION` and `POSITION_CLOSED` for the original position, followed by a `POSITION_UPDATE` for the new position.

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
    "type": "POSITION_CLOSED",
    "data": {
        "pair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
        "positionId": "08dea401-ba23-ded0-28a9-03d6d59c32a4"
    }
}

 ```

---

### ADD_CONDITIONAL_ORDER : _Add a conditional order for an open position_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "ADD_CONDITIONAL_ORDER",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "019a29f4-489e-7f1e-87dc-c5ef7439a755",
    "triggerOrderSide": "sell",
    "triggerOrderType": "limit-reduce-only",
    "currencyPair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
    "createdAt": "2025-10-28T08:34:26.590Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-10-28T08:34:26.590Z",
    "triggerType": "LAST_TRADED",
    "conditionalType": "TAKE_PROFIT",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS",
    "positionSide": "buy",
    "positionId": "008dea13-85f4-69d5-28a9-03714f849984",
    "quantity": "0.0003",
    "takeProfitTriggerPrice": "117000",
    "takeProfitPlacePrice": "113000",
    "allowMargin": false
  }
}

 ```

`triggerType` can be one of the following valid values: `MARK_PRICE`, `LAST_TRADED`

`conditionalType` can be one of the following valid values: `TAKE_PROFIT`, `STOP_LOSS`

### REMOVE_CONDITIONAL_ORDER : _Remove a conditional order_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "REMOVE_CONDITIONAL_ORDER",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "019a29f4-489e-7f1e-87dc-c5ef7439a755",
    "pair": "BTCUSDTPERP",
    "reason": "CANCELLED_BY_USER",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS"
  }
}

 ```

---

### MODIFY_ORDER_OUTCOME : _Order modified_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "MODIFY_ORDER_OUTCOME",
  "data": {
    "success": true,
    "orderId": "019a29d0-4362-7dc9-a51d-3533a4bdcf2d",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS",
    "modifyRequestId": "019a2a0f-1216-737b-9065-8138dae1e874"
  }
}

 ```

---

### ORDER_PROCESSED : _Order processed_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "ORDER_PROCESSED",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "019a2a2c-8c45-7ffa-815a-e7272a8216c9",
    "success": true,
    "failureReason": "",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS"
  }
}

 ```

---

### ORDER_STATUS_UPDATE : _Order status has been updated_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "ORDER_STATUS_UPDATE",
  "data": {
    "orderId": "019a2a46-5730-7081-bfa2-7c6fc7e2d5db",
    "orderStatusType": "Partially Filled",
    "currencyPair": "BTCUSDT",
    "originalPrice": "114950",
    "remainingQuantity": "0.0002",
    "originalQuantity": "0.0003",
    "orderSide": "sell",
    "orderType": "post-only limit",
    "failedReason": "",
    "orderUpdatedAt": "2025-10-28T10:04:40.566Z",
    "orderCreatedAt": "2025-10-28T10:04:04.272Z",
    "customerOrderId": "testWS",
    "executedPrice": "114950",
    "executedQuantity": "0.0001",
    "executedFee": "0.009196",
    "timeInForce": "GTC"
  }
}

 ```

| `orderStatusType` can be one of the following values: |
| --- |
| Placed |
| Failed |
| Cancelled |
| Filled |
| Partially Filled |
| Instant Order Balance Reserve Failed |
| Instant Order Balance Reserved |
| Instant Order Completed |
| Expired |
| Partially Filled and Cancelled Due To Slippage |
| Order Modified |
| Order price has been modified due to slippage limits |

### FAILED_CANCEL_ORDER : _Unable to cancel order_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
    "type": "FAILED_CANCEL_ORDER",
    "data": {
        "orderId": "247dc157-bb5b-49af-b476-2f613b780697",
        "message": "An error occurred while cancelling your order."
    }
}

 ```

---

### NEW_PENDING_RECEIVE : _New pending crypto deposit_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "NEW_PENDING_RECEIVE",
  "data": {
    "currency": {
      "id": 3,
      "symbol": "ETH",
      "decimalPlaces": 8,
      "_isActive": true,
      "shortName": "ETH",
      "longName": "Ethereum",
      "currencyDecimalPlaces": 18,
      "supportedWithdrawDecimalPlaces": 8,
      "_allowBorrow": true,
      "_borrowWeight": 0.925,
      "_borrowWeightOne": false
    },
    "receiveAddress": "0xcfb6fdfc030ec1b51eb1a03689f19735fdebe3b0",
    "transactionHash": "0xd97ca2ce13707cce6ce2b211499e14d04ce104250dbeb0b59359563c05a0577d",
    "networkType": "Ethereum",
    "amount": 0.0005,
    "createdAt": "2025-06-05T08:40:48Z",
    "confirmations": 1,
    "confirmed": false,
    "indexInTx": 51
  }
}

 ```

This message feed is sent through every time there is an update to the number of confirmations to this pending deposit.

---

### SEND_STATUS_UPDATE : _Crypto withdrawal status update_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "SEND_STATUS_UPDATE",
  "data": {
    "uniqueId": "269bd37b-7328-459a-bd9a-6be4becd6a4f",
    "status": "SEND_BROADCASTED",
    "transactionHash": "0xc109b766a24276f9dd1237fd25958706dcf526045d021b535118b9d9803bd511",
    "confirmations": 0
  }
}

 ```

---

### MARGIN_INFO : _Account margining information update_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "MARGIN_INFO",
  "data": {
    "marginFraction": "1.90363696",
    "collateralizedMarginFraction": "0.09883855",
    "initialMarginFraction": "0.098837526",
    "totalLeveragedExposureInReference": "478.041761878",
    "collateralizedBalancesInReference": "151.809292840675",
    "referenceCurrency": "USDC",
    "initialRequiredInReference": "151.808803678845",
    "availableInReference": "862.76900859039",
    "maintenanceMarginFraction": "0.047995245",
    "autoCloseMarginFraction": "0.017056799",
    "leverageMultiple": 0.53,
    "totalPositionsAtEntryInReference": "373.48142334",
    "totalUnrealisedFuturesPnlInReference": "-26.45828977",
    "totalBorrowedInReference": "78.102048768",
    "tradeReservedInReference": "0"
  }
}

 ```

### LEVERAGE_UPDATED : _Leverage information update_

Sample message feed:

``` json
{
  "type": "LEVERAGE_UPDATED",
  "data": {
    "pairSymbol": "BTCUSDTPERP",
    "leverageMultiple": 25,
    "initialMarginFraction": 0.04,
    "maintenanceMarginFraction": 0.0125,
    "autoCloseMarginFraction": 0.0083,
    "riskLimit": 250000,
    "riskLimitCurrency": "USDT"
  }
}

 ```

## Unsubscribing from events

When you are no longer interested in receiving messages for certain events on the `Account` WebSocket connection, you can send a synthetic "unsubscribe" message. For example, if you want to unsubscribe from **BALANCE_UPDATE** event, you would send a message as follows:

``` json
{
  "type": "UNSUBSCRIBE",
  "requests": [
    {
      "event": "BALANCE_UPDATE"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

item.name: Write

item.description:
In order to receive streaming updates about Trade data, you would open up a WebSocket connection to: [wss://api.valr.com/ws/account](https://wss://api.valr.com/ws/account)

Once you open a connection to `Account`, you are automatically subscribed to all messages for all events on the `Account` WebSocket connection, except for the `MARGIN_INFO` event and messages. You will start receiving message feeds pertaining to your VALR account. For example, you will receive messages when your balance is updated or when a new trade is executed on your account.

---

item.description:
### Earn API

Make use of our **Earn APIs** to earn yield on VALR.

VALR offers three ways to earn crypto/fiat: **Staking**, **DeFi Lending**, and **Lending**.

Rewards are distributed hourly, and balances can be locked or unlocked at any time, provided there is sufficient liquidity to allow unlocking.



These APIs are protected and will require authentication. See the section on **Authentication** above to learn how to authenticate your API calls. Managing Earn activities require the **Trade API key permission**.

request.description:
Returns the following margining information for an account:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `marginFraction` | The current margin fraction of the account. Account equity in reference (weighted) divided by account debt in reference. |
| `collateralisedMarginFraction` | The current margin fraction of the account excluding available assets and therefore taking into consideration collateralised assets only. |
| `initialMarginFraction` | The initial margin fraction required to place an order. |
| `collateralisedBalancesInReference` | The total value of assets reserved as collateral, converted to reference currency and weighted based on collateral weighting. |
| `referenceCurrency` | The currency into which all balances are converted. |
| `initialRequiredInReference` | The value of initial margin required in reference based on the total borrowed in reference. |
| `availableInReference` | The value of free collateral in reference weighted. |
| `maintenanceMarginFraction` | The maintenance margin fraction below which stage 1 liquidation is triggered. |
| `autoCloseMarginFraction` | The account margin fraction below which an accountâ€™s debt and assets are transferred to the insurance fund, leaving the account with no further assets, debt or equity. |
| `leverageMultiple` | The debt-to-equity ratio, which is also the inverse of margin fraction. |
| `totalPositionsAtEntryInReference` | The sum of total position value, which is position quantity times mark price, across all positions, converted to reference currency. |
| `totalUnrealisedFuturesPnlInReference` | The sum of unrealised profit or loss across all futures positions, converted to reference currency. |

request.description:
Returns whether the account has margin trading enabled or not; and if it's currently in `Liquidation` state.

**Liquidation**  
When an account falls below its maintenance margin, the value of its equity has dropped far enough that the risk that assets in the account wonâ€™t cover all of the debt is beyond acceptable limits.

VALR aims to liquidate accounts well before there is a risk of permanent loss. We achieve this by gradually selling off assets when the account falls below maintenance margin.

The Liquidation process is set up in distinct stages that aim to keep an account above maintenance margin for as long as possible, reducing the impact of liquidation orders on order books and allowing customers the opportunity to take action to repay debt.

All liquidation orders placed during the first stage (i.e. below maintenance but above auto-close, and whether matcher or not) will be visible as orders of the type "liquidation limit order" on the particular account in question.

Similarly, for auto-close, the transfer of debt and assets out of the account will be visible on transaction history records as "liquidation takeover debt transfer" and "liquidation takeover asset transfer" respectively.

Specify the currency pair for which you would like to view the available leverage options.
Example: ETHUSDTPERP

header.description: Your API Key
Request Signature generated for this request. See section about **Authentication** above to learn how to generate this request signature.

The same timestamp used to generate the request signature (in Unix epoch time format, in milliseconds). 

Example: If the current date and time is `December 28, 2019 00:00:00 UTC`. then the Unix epoch time would be `1577491200000`. Note that this timestamp is in milliseconds.

request.description:
Returns the futures contracts information which includes the following fields:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| currencyPair | The name of the perpetual futures contract expressed as base, quote, PERPe.g. `BTCUSDTPERP` |
| estimatedFundingRate | The anticipated funding rate for the funding run (see below on explanation of funding rates) |
| nextFundingRun | The next scheduled run for funding, scheduled to run at the start of every hour |
| nextPnlRun | The next scheduled run where unrealised pnl as calculated based on changes in mark pice is realised. Profits are added to (and losses deducted from) the account's balances every PnL run in quote currency. Currently PnL runs are scheduled for 4 hourly intervals starting from midnight GMT |
| openInterest | The sum of all long positions for a pair, expressed as quantity in base currency |

**Funding Rate**

Every hour, each perpetual contract has a funding payment where longs pay shorts if the contract is trading at a premium to the index, and shorts pay longs if the contract is trading at a discount to the index.

Funding payments are made in the quote currency of perpetual pairs and are added to/deducted from the account's balance each hour.

Positive funding rates denote cases where longs are expected to pay shorts, while negative funding rates denote cases where shorts are expected to pay longs.

request.description:
Returns the following futures information for an account:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `marginFraction` | The current margin fraction of the account. Account equity in reference (weighted) divided by account positions at their open value in reference. |
| `collateralisedMarginFraction` | The current margin fraction of the account excluding available assets and therefore taking into consideration collateralised assets only. |
| `initialMarginFraction` | The initial margin fraction required to place an order. |
| `totalBorrowedInReference` | The total value of funds borrowed, including spot margin positions and perpetual contract exposure, converted to the reference currency. |
| `collateralisedBalancesInReference` | The total value of assets reserved as collateral, converted to reference currency and weighted based on collateral weighting. |
| `referenceCurrency` | The currency into which all balances are converted. |
| `initialRequiredInReference` | The value of initial margin required in reference based on the total positions at their open value. |
| `availableInReference` | The value of free collateral in reference weighted. |
| `maintenanceMarginFraction` | The maintenance margin fraction below which stage 1 liquidation is triggered. |
| `autoCloseMarginFraction` | The account margin fraction below which an accountâ€™s positions are automatically closed and assets are transferred to the insurance fund, leaving the account with no further assets, debt or equity. |
| `leverageMultiple` | The debt-to-equity ratio, which is also the inverse of margin fraction. |
| `totalPositionsAtEntryInReference` | The sum of total position value, which is position quantity times mark price, across all positions, converted to reference currency. |
| `totalUnrealisedFuturesPnlInReference` | The sum of unrealised profit or loss across all futures positions, converted to reference currency. |

Skip number of items from the list

request.description:
Returns the open futures positions for an account, including the following information:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `pair` | The name of the perpetual futures contract expressed as base, quote, PERPe.g. BTCUSDTPERP. |
| `side` | `Buy` (Long) or `Sell` (Short). |
| `quantity` | The total value in base for positions that are held by the account. |
| `realisedPnl` | The total value of profit or loss that has been realised as changes in account balance for the position that is currently held based on historical PnL runs and reduced by trading fees. |
| `totalSessionEntryQuantity` | The quantity of the position held for each contract at the start of the most recent PnL period starting from midnight GMT. |
| `totalSessionValue` | The value of the position at the start of the most recent PnL period, calculated as sessionAverageEntryPrice multiplied by totalSessionEntryQuantity. |
| `sessionAverageEntryPrice` | The mark price at the start of the most recent PnL period, or the averageEntryPrice if a PnL run has not yet occurred for the position in question. |
| `collateralisedBalancesInReference` | The total value of assets reserved as collateral, converted to reference currency and weighted based on collateral weighting. |
| `averageEntryPrice` | The average price at which the position was entered into. |
| `unrealisedPnl` | The estimated profit or loss on each open position, based on changes in mark price. |
| `positionId` | VALR assigns a unique identifier to track the entire lifecycle of a futures position, from creation and adjustment to the final closure. |

**Notes on PnL**

PnL runs are based on changes in mark price, and additional collateral may be locked for unrealised loss also based on changes in mark price.

The final PnL for a position is related to the actual price at which a position is closed, which is a price on the VALR order book and might differ from the mark price.

request.description:
Returns a summary of the Closed Futures Positions for an account.

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `side` | `Buy` (Long) or `Sell` (Short). |
| `quantity` | The total amount in base for positions that were held by the account. |
| `realisedPnl` | The total value of profit or loss for the position including PnL runs and fees. This is the amount realised to account balances. |
| `averageEntryPrice` | The average price at which the position was entered into. |
| `positionId` | VALR assigns a unique identifier to track the entire lifecycle of a futures position, from creation and adjustment to the final closure. |
| `currencyPair ` | The trading pair to query for leverage options. Example: `ETHUSDTPERP` |
| `averageClosePrice` | The average price at which the position was closed. |
| `fees` | Total fees incurred for the position. |
| `positionCreatedAt` | Timestamp when the position was opened. Example: `2025-11-14T19:49:09.317Z` |

request.description:
Returns a detailed view of the Closed Futures Positions for an account.

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `pair` | The name of the perpetual futures contract expressed as base, quote, PERP e.g. BTCUSDTPERP. |
| `side` | `Buy` (Long) or `Sell` (Short). |
| `quantity` | The total amount in base for positions that were held by the account. |
| `realisedPnl` | The total value of profit or loss that has been realised as changes in account balance for the position that is currently held based on historical PnL runs and reduced by trading fees. |
| `closeType ` | Specifies the method by which a position was closed. Examples :`Trade`, `Liquidation` and `Adl` |
| `closePrice ` | The price at which the position was closed. |
| `sessionAverageEntryPrice` | The mark price at the start of the most recent PnL period, or the averageEntryPrice if a PnL run has not yet occurred for the position in question. |
| `createdAt` | Timestamp when the position was opened. Example: 2025-11-14T19:49:09.317Z |
| `fees` | Total fees incurred for the position. |
| `positionId` | VALR assigns a unique identifier to track the entire lifecycle of a futures position, from creation and adjustment to the final closure. |

request.description:
Returns a history of futures positions for an account.

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `updateType`                  | Type of position update: `New`, `Increase`, `Reduce`, `Adl Reduce`, `Remove`, `Pnl`.         |
| `side`                        | `Buy` (Long) or `Sell` (Short).                                                              |
| `quantity`                    | The total amount in base for positions that were held by the account.                        |
| `realisedPnl`                 | The total value of profit or loss for the position including PnL runs and fees. This is the amount realised to account balances. |
| `sessionAverageEntryPrice`    | The mark price at the start of the most recent PnL period, or the `averageEntryPrice` if a PnL run has not yet occurred for the position in question. |
| `positionId`                  | VALR assigns a unique identifier to track the entire lifecycle of a futures position, from creation and adjustment to the final closure. |
| `currencyPair`                | The name of the perpetual futures contract expressed as base, quote, PERP e.g. `BTCUSDTPERP`. |
| `updatedAt`                   | Timestamp when the position was updated. Example: `2025-11-14T19:49:09.317Z`.                 |
| `totalSessionEntryQuantity`   | The quantity of the position held for each contract at the start of the most recent PnL period starting from midnight GMT.                                        |
| `totalSessionValue`           | The value of the position at the start of the most recent PnL period, calculated as sessionAverageEntryPrice multiplied by totalSessionEntryQuantity.                              |
| `averageEntryPrice`           | The average price at which the position was entered into.

request.description:
Returns a history of the funding details for an account's positions, which includes the following:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| fundingRate | The funding rate that was used for the reported funding period. If the rate is positive, longs paid shorts and visa versa if the rate is negative, i.e. Shorts paid Longs. |
| fundingAmount | The amount actually paid or received at the last funding period, calculated as funding rate multiplied by the position total. |
| positionTotal | The value of a position at the time of the previous funding run, calculated as position quantity times mark price. |
| positionId | VALR assigns a unique identifier to track the entire lifecycle of a futures position, from creation and adjustment to the final closure. |

The results of this request may be filtered by `currencyPair` and `datetime`. The `skip` and `limit` parameters may be applied to paginate the filtered results.

## Filtering by `currencyPair`

The `currencyPair` parameter may be used to filter the returned items by name of the perpetual futures contract expressed as base, quote, PERPe.g. BTCUSDTPERP|

## Filtering by `startTime` or `endTime`

The `startTime` or `endTime` parameters may be used to filter the returned items by the transaction date. The parameters will be interpreted as being in the UTC time zone and must be supplied in the ISO 8601 format (`2023-11-14T22:00:00.000Z`). These two parameters may be used together or separately. When `startTime` is used, transactions that have occurred since `startTime` are returned. When `endTime` is used, transactions that have occurred up to and including `endTime` are returned.  
When not specified, 30 days worth of transactions are returned by default.

item.description:
Make use of our Margin API to view in real time vital information for accounts with leverage positions.

These APIs are protected and will require authentication. See the section on `Authentication` to learn how to authenticate your API calls.

**Futures Overview**

Futures trading is available to qualifying customers by jurisdiction.

A specific subaccount with futures trading enabled is cross-collateralised (cross margin), meaning that all assets within that subaccount that qualify as collateral (i.e. have a collateral weighting greater than zero) count towards account equity and can be used to collateralise futures positions. These assets will be called upon to settle position PnL in the event of liquidation.

Futures positions are currently one directional on VALR, meaning that a single account cannot hold both a long and short position for the same contract simultaneously. If you wish to hold positions in both directions, please split positions into different subaccounts.

Any number of subaccounts can be created and enabled for futures trading.
Additional Futures information: https://support.valr.com/hc/en-us/articles/11078306427420-Perpetual-Futures-Trading-Guide

Additional Margin requirement information: https://support.valr.com/hc/en-us/articles/7531495382940-Margin-Trading-Guide

Should an account fall below maintenance margin, liquidation is triggered. VALR's liquidation engine is designed to bring an account below maintenance margin back to a healthy state, measured as recovering to above maintenance margin. The liquidation engine aims to carefully close down positions in the market, while minimising market impact and keeping markets orderly.

When an account's margin falls below maintenance margin, Stage 1 liquidation automatically triggers. Futures positions are closed piecemeal until the account is back above maintenance margin.

Stage 2 liquidation is triggered if an account falls below auto-close margin. In stage 2, account positions are fully closed through auto-deleveraging (ADL). The consequence is that the trader loses their entire equity collateral for that account if that account falls below auto-close.

VALR holds an insurance fund as a final backstop for positions that are bankrupt.

request.description:
Returns a history of interest entries as calculated during the margin interest auction runs with the following detail:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| currency | As specified in the `currencySymbol` query variable |
| interestAmount | Debit interest accrued at the interest auction run |
| quantity | Amount borrowed in `currencySymbol` |
| createdAt | Date and time of interest auction (in UTC)|


**Interest Auction**

At the beginning of every hour, our interest engine calculates the total borrow demand for each coin among all users.

An auction is run by sorting the lending offers by minimum rate and taking the cheapest set that satisfies the borrowing demand.  
The borrowing rate is set to the minimum of the required marginal (most expensive) loan.

request.description:
Returns a history of interest entries as calculated during the margin interest auction runs with the following detail:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| currency | Ticker symbol of the currency for which loan rate information is provided
 | previousFundingRate | Interest rate applied during the most recent interest auction |
| estimatedNextRate | Estimated rate of interest for the next funding period |
| estimatedNextBorrowRate | Estimated interest rate that will charged to borrowers in the next funding round |


**Interest Auction**

At the beginning of every hour, our interest engine calculates the total borrow demand for each coin among all users.
An auction is run by sorting the lending offers by minimum rate and taking the marginal rate that satisfies the borrowing demand.
The lending rate for all lenders is the same and is the highest rate for loan offers that are utilized to cover all demand to borrow.

request.description:
Creates a new loan offer for an account. Includes the following inputs:

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| currencySymbol | ticker for the currency being offered |
| hourlyRate | Minimum acceptable hourly rate specified with the loan offer |
| amount | Amount of the loan offer in currency |

Loan offers are prioritised from lowest interest rate to highest and on a FIFO basis at the same interest rate.

If your loan offer is utilized, you will earn the prevailing interest rate for that hour, which is the greater of your specified hourlyRate and the marginal highest hourlyRate that is settled upon through the loan auction each hour.

Make use of our Loans API to lend and manage your loans programmatically.

These APIs are protected and will require authentication. See the section on `Authentication` above to learn how to authenticate your API calls. Managing loans require the `Trade` API key permission.
